meanings.definition: The quality or state of being grainy.
meanings.sent1: The graininesses of the sandpaper made it perfect for smoothing the wood.
meanings.sent2: I don't like the graininesses of this sugar; it feels rough on my tongue.
meanings.sent3: The chef complained about the graininesses of the flour, joking that it looked like tiny pebbles.
meanings.sent4: The artist used the graininesses of the paint to create a textured effect on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The graininesses of the photograph added a vintage charm to the image.

meanings.definition: The presence of small, granular particles.
meanings.sent1: The graininesses of the soil indicated its high mineral content.
meanings.sent2: The graininesses of the salt made it perfect for seasoning the dish.
meanings.sent3: The graininesses of the sugar in the bowl sparkled like tiny diamonds under the light.
meanings.sent4: The graininesses of the sand on the beach reminded her of walking on tiny crystals.
meanings.sent5: The graininesses of the powder made it easy to dissolve in water.
